euInitiatives:
As one of the leading global law firms, Linklaters LLP undertakes assignments for the world's leading companies, financial institutions and governments, helping them to achieve their objectives by solving their most complex and important legal issues. The firm's work is divided into three broad divisions for management purposes: Corporate; Dispute Resolution and Finance and Projects. The EU policies relevant to the firm include financial regulation, corporate law, intellectual property law, competition, digital single market, energy and environmental law. EU initiatives and legislative proposals relevant to the firm include: - the completion of the banking union, EU green deal; Regulation establishing an European deposit insurance scheme; Regulation on taxonomy; Regulation on crowdfunding service providers; ESAS review package
- Recovery and resolution of CCPs Regulation; Digital taxation package; C(C)CTB Directives; Public country-by-country reporting Directive; Financial transaction tax Directive; e-privacy Regulation; Review of the horizontal block exemption Regulations; Review of the general block exemption Regulation.
